stories.title: Development Environment Setup
stories.acceptance_criteria: Development, staging, and production environments are configured with proper secrets management, environment variables, and deployment targets
stories.risks: Cloud provider configuration complexity and credential management
stories.comments: Includes Docker containerization, environment-specific configs, and local development setup
stories.assumptions: Using standard cloud provider (AWS/Azure/GCP) with managed services for database and hosting

stories.title: CI/CD Pipeline Configuration
stories.acceptance_criteria: Automated build, test, and deployment pipeline with proper branching strategy, code quality gates, and deployment approvals
stories.risks: Pipeline complexity and integration with multiple environments
stories.comments: Includes automated testing, code coverage, security scanning, and deployment automation
stories.assumptions: Using GitHub Actions or similar CI/CD platform with standard deployment patterns

stories.title: Database Schema and Knowledge Graph Setup
stories.acceptance_criteria: Database schema created with proper indexing, relationships, and knowledge graph structure for AI-powered search and recommendations
stories.risks: Knowledge graph complexity and performance optimization for large datasets
stories.comments: Includes user management, content storage, search indexing, and AI model integration schemas
stories.assumptions: Using PostgreSQL with vector extensions or similar for knowledge graph capabilities

stories.title: Azure AD SSO Login
stories.acceptance_criteria: User can authenticate via Azure AD SSO, redirected to dashboard on success, error handling for failed auth
stories.risks: Azure AD configuration complexity and tenant-specific requirements
stories.comments: Requires Azure AD app registration, MSAL.js integration, token handling
stories.assumptions: Azure AD tenant is already configured, standard enterprise SSO flow

stories.title: User Session Management
stories.acceptance_criteria: Sessions persist across browser refresh, automatic logout on token expiry, secure token storage
stories.risks: Token refresh timing and secure storage implementation
stories.comments: JWT token management, refresh token flow, secure httpOnly cookies
stories.assumptions: Standard JWT token lifecycle, 8-hour session duration

epics.name: Search & Discovery
epics.description: Semantic search functionality and result presentation

stories.title: Search Dashboard UI
stories.acceptance_criteria: User can access search dashboard with proper layout, navigation, and responsive design matching design tokens
stories.risks: Complex responsive layout requirements
stories.comments: Implement using design system components, ensure proper spacing and typography per design tokens
stories.assumptions: Design system components are already available, no complex animations required

stories.title: Search Input and Validation
stories.acceptance_criteria: User can enter search queries with real-time validation, character limits, and proper error states
stories.risks: Input validation complexity and edge cases
stories.comments: Include debouncing for real-time validation, handle special characters and query length limits
stories.assumptions: Basic text input validation, no advanced query syntax parsing required

stories.title: Search Filters Panel
stories.acceptance_criteria: User can apply multiple filters with clear/reset functionality, filter state persistence, and intuitive UI
stories.risks: Complex filter combinations and state management
stories.comments: Implement collapsible filter groups, multi-select options, date ranges, and filter chips
stories.assumptions: Maximum 8-10 filter types, standard filter UI patterns acceptable

stories.title: Semantic Search API
stories.acceptance_criteria: API endpoint processes natural language queries and returns semantically relevant results with confidence scores
stories.risks: Integration complexity with vector database and ML models
stories.comments: Integrate with vector database, implement query preprocessing, result ranking algorithm
stories.assumptions: Using existing vector database service (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate), pre-trained embeddings model available

stories.title: Vector Embeddings and Indexing
stories.acceptance_criteria: Content is automatically converted to vector embeddings and indexed for semantic search with batch processing capability
stories.risks: Large-scale indexing performance and embedding model selection
stories.comments: Implement batch processing for embeddings generation, incremental indexing, embedding model management
stories.assumptions: Using cloud-based embedding service (OpenAI, Cohere), existing content database structure

stories.title: Search Filtering Logic
stories.acceptance_criteria: Backend applies multiple filters to search results with proper boolean logic and performance optimization
stories.risks: Query performance with complex filter combinations
stories.comments: Implement efficient database queries, filter caching, query optimization for large datasets
stories.assumptions: Database supports complex filtering, reasonable dataset size (<1M records initially)

stories.title: Search Results Display
stories.acceptance_criteria: Search results display with relevance scores, snippets, metadata, and proper loading/empty states
stories.risks: Result card layout complexity and performance with large result sets
stories.comments: Implement result cards with highlighting, metadata display, loading skeletons, empty states
stories.assumptions: Standard result card layout, text highlighting for search terms, basic metadata display

stories.title: Relevance Scoring and Ranking
stories.acceptance_criteria: Results are ranked by relevance with configurable scoring algorithm and score transparency for users
stories.risks: Relevance algorithm accuracy and performance tuning
stories.comments: Implement hybrid scoring (semantic + keyword), result re-ranking, score normalization
stories.assumptions: Basic relevance scoring acceptable initially, no ML-based ranking required

stories.title: Load More Results
stories.acceptance_criteria: Users can load additional results with pagination or infinite scroll, maintaining search context and performance
stories.risks: Performance degradation with large result sets and state management complexity
stories.comments: Implement cursor-based pagination, result caching, smooth loading transitions
stories.assumptions: Infinite scroll preferred over traditional pagination, reasonable page sizes (20-50 results)

stories.title: Similarities and Differences Analysis
stories.acceptance_criteria: Display AI-generated analysis comparing similarities and differences between search results and query context. Show analysis in expandable sections with clear visual hierarchy.
stories.risks: LLM response quality and consistency may vary significantly
stories.comments: Requires integration with LLM service and proper error handling for failed analysis. Consider caching analysis results.
stories.assumptions: LLM service is already selected and accessible via API

stories.title: LLM Integration for Content Analysis
stories.acceptance_criteria: Integrate with LLM service to analyze memo content and generate relevance scores, similarities, and differences. Handle API failures gracefully with fallback messaging.
stories.risks: LLM API rate limits and costs could impact system performance
stories.comments: Need to implement prompt engineering, response parsing, and error handling. Consider implementing request queuing for rate limiting.
stories.assumptions: LLM service supports the required analysis capabilities and has sufficient rate limits

stories.title: Memo Summary Generation
stories.acceptance_criteria: Generate AI-powered summaries of memo content including key points, main topics, and actionable items. Support different summary lengths (brief, detailed).
stories.risks: Summary quality may not meet user expectations for complex or technical memos
stories.comments: Requires careful prompt engineering to ensure consistent summary format. Need to handle very long memos that exceed LLM context limits.
stories.assumptions: LLM can process memo content within token limits and generate coherent summaries

stories.title: Summary Display Interface
stories.acceptance_criteria: Display generated summaries with options to expand/collapse sections, regenerate summary, and provide feedback on summary quality. Include loading states and error handling.
stories.risks: Complex interaction patterns may confuse users if not designed intuitively
stories.comments: Need to implement progressive disclosure for different summary sections. Consider adding copy-to-clipboard functionality.
stories.assumptions: Summary data structure is well-defined and consistent from backend API

stories.title: Memo Detail View
stories.acceptance_criteria: User can navigate to memo detail page, view memo in clean layout with proper navigation and responsive design
stories.risks: Complex layout requirements and responsive behavior across devices
stories.comments: Requires routing setup, page layout component, and integration with memo API. Consider print-friendly styling.
stories.assumptions: Memo ID is passed via URL parameter, basic memo structure is already defined

stories.title: Memo Metadata Display
stories.acceptance_criteria: Display memo title, date, author, classification, distribution list, and other metadata in organized format
stories.risks: Metadata formatting complexity and handling missing/optional fields
stories.comments: Need to handle various metadata types, date formatting, and classification badges. Consider metadata edit permissions.
stories.assumptions: Metadata schema is well-defined, classification levels are predetermined

stories.title: Memo Content Rendering
stories.acceptance_criteria: Render memo body content with proper formatting, handle rich text, images, tables, and maintain document structure
stories.risks: Rich text rendering complexity, security concerns with HTML content, performance with large documents
stories.comments: May need rich text editor component or markdown renderer. Consider content sanitization and XSS protection.
stories.assumptions: Content format is standardized (HTML/Markdown), no complex embedded media beyond images

stories.title: Memo Content API
stories.acceptance_criteria: API endpoint to retrieve memo content by ID with proper error handling, caching, and performance optimization
stories.risks: Performance with large memo content, database query optimization, caching strategy
stories.comments: Include content versioning support, lazy loading for large documents, and proper error responses for missing memos.
stories.assumptions: Database schema supports memo storage, authentication/authorization is handled separately

stories.title: Memo Metadata Management
stories.acceptance_criteria: API endpoints for memo metadata CRUD operations with validation, audit logging, and permission checks
stories.risks: Data validation complexity, audit trail requirements, permission matrix implementation
stories.comments: Include metadata validation rules, change tracking, and bulk operations support. Consider metadata templates.
stories.assumptions: User permission system exists, audit logging infrastructure is available

stories.title: Draft New Memo Interface
stories.acceptance_criteria: User can access draft memo page, see form fields for memo details, navigate between sections, and save draft progress
stories.risks: Complex form state management across multiple sections
stories.comments: Multi-step form with validation, auto-save functionality, responsive design for legal document creation
stories.assumptions: Form has 3-4 main sections, standard validation patterns, no complex conditional logic

stories.title: Template Selection
stories.acceptance_criteria: User can browse available memo templates, preview template structure, select template, and initialize new memo with template data
stories.risks: Template preview complexity and data structure variations
stories.comments: Template gallery with search/filter, preview modal, template metadata handling
stories.assumptions: 10-15 predefined templates, simple preview without full rendering, templates stored as structured data

stories.title: AI-Assisted Draft Generation
stories.acceptance_criteria: System generates memo content based on user inputs, provides AI suggestions for improvements, allows iterative refinement of generated content
stories.risks: AI service integration reliability and response time variability
stories.comments: Integration with AI service (OpenAI/similar), streaming responses, error handling for AI failures, content refinement UI
stories.assumptions: External AI API available, streaming responses supported, 5-10 second typical response time

stories.title: Header Navigation
stories.acceptance_criteria: Header displays with logo, main navigation links, user menu, and search bar. Responsive behavior on mobile with hamburger menu.
stories.risks: Complex responsive behavior and mobile menu interactions
stories.comments: Needs to work across all pages. Consider sticky header behavior. Mobile menu requires JavaScript state management.
stories.assumptions: Design tokens are finalized. Navigation structure is stable. No complex mega-menu required.

stories.title: Breadcrumb Navigation
stories.acceptance_criteria: Breadcrumb trail shows current page hierarchy. Clickable links to parent pages. Auto-generates based on route structure.
stories.risks: Dynamic breadcrumb generation complexity
stories.comments: Should integrate with routing system. Consider SEO structured data markup.
stories.assumptions: Route hierarchy is well-defined. No complex nested categories beyond 3-4 levels.

stories.title: User Menu and Profile
stories.acceptance_criteria: User avatar/name in header opens dropdown menu. Menu includes profile, settings, logout options. Shows user role/permissions.
stories.risks: User session management and role-based menu items
stories.comments: Dropdown positioning and click-outside behavior. User avatar fallback for no profile image.
stories.assumptions: User authentication is implemented. Basic user profile data available via API.

stories.title: Search Error Handling
stories.acceptance_criteria: Graceful handling of search API failures. User-friendly error messages. Retry mechanisms for transient failures.
stories.risks: Distinguishing between different error types and appropriate user messaging
stories.comments: Need error boundary components. Consider offline state handling. Log errors for monitoring.
stories.assumptions: Backend provides structured error responses. Error monitoring system exists.

stories.title: Content Loading Error States
stories.acceptance_criteria: Error states for failed content loads. Retry buttons where appropriate. Fallback content or navigation options.
stories.risks: Consistent error handling patterns across different content types
stories.comments: Reusable error components. Consider partial failure scenarios. Accessibility for error states.
stories.assumptions: Design system includes error state patterns. Backend provides consistent error format.

stories.title: Empty State Displays
stories.acceptance_criteria: Helpful empty states when no search results found. Suggestions for alternative searches. Clear messaging for different empty scenarios.
stories.risks: Providing meaningful guidance without overwhelming the user
stories.comments: Different empty states: no results, no filters match, initial state. Consider search suggestions.
stories.assumptions: Search analytics available to suggest alternatives. Content for empty state messaging provided.

stories.title: Search Loading States
stories.acceptance_criteria: Loading indicators during search execution. Progressive loading for large result sets. Skeleton screens for search results.
stories.risks: Performance perception during slow searches
stories.comments: Debounced search input. Skeleton components matching result card structure. Cancel previous requests.
stories.assumptions: Search API supports pagination. Design includes skeleton screen patterns.

stories.title: Content Loading Indicators
stories.acceptance_criteria: Consistent loading indicators across application. Skeleton screens for content areas. Progress indicators for long operations.
stories.risks: Consistent loading experience across different content types
stories.comments: Reusable loading components. Consider lazy loading for images. Accessibility for loading states.
stories.assumptions: Design system includes loading patterns. Performance requirements defined for loading thresholds.

epics.name: Data Management
epics.description: Backend data processing and knowledge graph management

stories.title: Memo Corpus Ingestion
stories.acceptance_criteria: System can ingest memo documents from various sources (upload, API, file system), extract text content, validate format, and store in processing queue with metadata
stories.risks: Document format variations and encoding issues may require additional parsing logic
stories.comments: Needs file upload handling, document parsing (PDF, DOCX, TXT), and queue management. Consider using libraries like Apache Tika for document parsing
stories.assumptions: Standard document formats only, no OCR required for scanned documents, reasonable file size limits (< 50MB per document)

stories.title: Relationship Mapping
stories.acceptance_criteria: System analyzes memo content to identify and map relationships between entities (people, organizations, topics), creates relationship graph with confidence scores
stories.risks: NLP accuracy for entity recognition and relationship extraction may vary significantly across different memo types and writing styles
stories.comments: Requires NLP pipeline for named entity recognition, relationship extraction algorithms, and graph database integration. Consider using spaCy or similar NLP libraries
stories.assumptions: Using pre-trained NLP models, English language only, acceptable accuracy threshold of 80% for entity recognition

stories.title: Content Indexing Pipeline
stories.acceptance_criteria: System creates searchable indexes of memo content, maintains full-text search capabilities, updates indexes incrementally as new content is added
stories.risks: Index performance may degrade with large document volumes, requiring optimization strategies
stories.comments: Implement using Elasticsearch or similar search engine, with incremental indexing and proper text analysis pipelines. Include stemming and synonym handling
stories.assumptions: Using managed search service (AWS OpenSearch/Elasticsearch), documents are primarily text-based, search response time under 500ms for typical queries

stories.title: End-to-End Testing Suite
stories.acceptance_criteria: Automated E2E tests cover critical user journeys including authentication, navigation, form submissions, and data operations with proper test data management
stories.risks: Test flakiness and maintenance overhead as application evolves
stories.comments: Use Playwright or Cypress. Include tests for responsive behavior and accessibility. Set up test data seeding and cleanup.
stories.assumptions: Testing framework choice is flexible, test environments are available, team has E2E testing experience

stories.title: API Testing and Validation
stories.acceptance_criteria: Comprehensive API test suite covering all endpoints with validation of request/response schemas, error handling, authentication, and edge cases
stories.risks: Incomplete coverage of edge cases and error scenarios
stories.comments: Use Jest/Supertest or similar. Include contract testing, rate limiting tests, and security validation. Mock external dependencies.
stories.assumptions: API documentation is complete, test database can be isolated, external service mocks are feasible

stories.title: Performance Testing
stories.acceptance_criteria: Load testing validates system performance under expected traffic with monitoring of response times, throughput, and resource utilization
stories.risks: Performance bottlenecks discovered late requiring architectural changes
stories.comments: Use k6 or Artillery for load testing. Include database performance monitoring. Test both API and frontend performance.
stories.assumptions: Performance requirements are defined, production-like test environment available, monitoring tools in place
